benchmark_details.name: CReSt (A Comprehensive Benchmark for Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Complex Reasoning over Structured Documents)
benchmark_details.overview: CReSt is a benchmark designed to evaluate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems in complex reasoning scenarios over structured documents, incorporating multiple dimensions such as reasoning capabilities, refusal to answer appropriately, citation accuracy, and understanding of document structure.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive framework for evaluating the capabilities necessary for practical RAG applications.

data.source: Documents sourced from Common Crawl and National Assembly Library of Korea.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from the evaluation of answers against a gold standard using external LLMs for semantic equivalence.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect both correctness and the ability to identify citations accurately.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance evaluated using multiple state-of-the-art models including GPT-4o and Qwen2.5 series.
methodology.validation: Each QA pair is verified through human assessment of correctness and evidence alignment.
